image.altText: Rishi Sunak looks down as he speaks while a man stands behind him holding a sign that says: "L".

props.synopsis: The Tories have been punished by voters at the ballot box for a series of explosive scandals. Experts say the party's next steps aren't clear.

title.children: Britain's Conservatives have written a 'children's playbook' of political scandal but two moments will keep them awake at night

image.altText: Hillcrest Primary School in Devonport

props.synopsis: The criminal court case over the Tasmanian jumping castle tragedy, which claimed the lives of six children, has faced another delay over concerns over the inspection of the castle used that fateful day.

title.children: Hillcrest criminal court case delayed as efforts made to inspect jumping castle

image.altText: Storm clouds gather over Cracknet Lookout on the new south wales Central Coast

props.synopsis: Three separate cloud bands sweeping across Australia during the coming week are likely to drop at least a few millimetres of rain on every patch of ground south of Brisbane to Geraldton.

title.children: Widespread soaking ahead for Australia as BOM now tips wet winter and spring

image.altText: Couple smiles and holds hands on their wedding day, professional shot of woman with red hair up-do and wedding dress

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian woman will spend three years in jail after encouraging her husband to attack their neighbour with a chainsaw. Â

title.children: 'Kill him, Neville': Woman sentenced after husband's 'malicious' chainsaw attack on neighbour

image.altText: Riding a shiny, chocolate-coloured, muscular horse, a woman in a navy blazer watches three hounds sniffing in an open field.

props.synopsis: A long-held English tradition is being kept alive by a dedicated group of mostly female horse riders in northern Tasmania.

title.children: Inside the female-led horse and hound hunt club where they don't kill anything at all

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, Fatima Payman and Peter dutton in a composite image of three photos

props.synopsis: It's been a wild week in politics, both here in Australia and across the world. It's a reflection that recent events in the Middle East will continue to dominate and divide voters for some time to come.Â

title.children: The fallout from Payman's departure continues, as international elections reflect the war in Gaza's impact on voter division

image.altText: A number of beauty products placed on a vibrant pink display stand.

props.synopsis: It was an innocent-enough question to put to the boss of Australia's fastest growing beauty brand: How do you sit with the ethics of duping? The clip went viral, but it shows there are shades of grey at the heart of makeup dupes.

title.children: It took just eight words to set social media ablaze: 'How do you sit with the ethics of duping?'

image.altText: A woman with a scarf and with sunglasses rested on her head, and a man in a jumper.

props.synopsis: Pacific Island workers coming home from Australia say it's a long and complicated process to get their superannuation â and the barriers appear to be stopping many from claiming their money.

title.children: 'This is their hard-earned money': The battle these workers face claiming their super

image.altText: Tree pink ribbon dark

props.synopsis:
Sometimes they're armed with a chainsaw, sometimes a bottle of poison, and often they're operating in broad daylight. So why is it so hard to catch Sydney's tree killers?

Â

title.children: 'Money always wins': Inside Sydney's underground tree-killing industry

image.altText: A graphic of a woman in a suit standing next to a man in a suit.

props.synopsis: The federal government is making the Counter Foreign Interference Taskforce permanent and expanding it to include agencies such as the ATO as one of several new measures to fight the growing threat of foreign interference.

title.children: Plots to eliminate dissidents inside Australia disrupted as government boosts efforts to fight foreign interference

image.altText: Caucasian woman with blonde hair

props.synopsis: Dr Bagus Mahadewa from the Ngoerah General Hospital where Rebecca Ode was treated said the Newcastle woman is able to speak but cannot remember what happened.

title.children: Indonesian police reveal details about how an Australian woman lost an eye in Bali

image.altText: A white double-storey house in South Melbourne.

props.synopsis: This once-resplendent South Melbourne cottage built by a well-to-do Scottish baker in the 1880s had slipped into ruin, with an alarming tilt to boot.

title.children: With rotted floors and overgrown vines, this Melbourne couple tackled what seemed like an impossible renovation

image.altText: A sign saying 'Ashley Youth Detention Centre' outside some fencing.

props.synopsis: The criminal justice system is complex. But imagine being a young offender, with limited access to legal advice, sitting on remand for months in a youth detention centre. That is the reality in Tasmania, but there are calls for change.

title.children: Sitting in Ashley detention centre for months, youth often have 'no idea' where their court cases are up to

image.altText: Two text bubbles with messages like "You played really well today mate!"

props.synopsis: A former Tasmanian cop repeatedly groomed boys over his decades-long career. A report into Paul Reynolds has outlined how he used his standing in the community to do it.

title.children: 'The funniest bloke I've ever met': How paedophile police officer Paul Reynolds groomed an entire community

image.altText: A stainless steel hatch in a sloped landscape

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian artist who built a fire bunker on her property in Tasmania has been fined, for failing to have the permit for its installation.

title.children: Tasmanian woman directed to stop using own fire bunker, fined $8,000

image.altText: A bowl of dumpling soup with broccoli and tofu topped with coriander and sliced chilli.

props.synopsis: Frozen dumplings make weeknight cooking easy. In this comforting recipe, they're served in a hot and sour soup in a dish that mashes up Chinese wonton soup and Thai tom yum soup.

title.children: Transform a bag of frozen dumplings into a satisfying spicy soup

image.altText: A young woman lies in bed with her hand on her forehead, unable to sleep

props.synopsis: Getting some good shut-eye is important for your overall health and wellbeing. But slight changes like less daylight and a drop in temperatures can make that tough. Here's what experts say you can do to improve your winter sleep.Â

title.children: Have you been waking up through the night lately? The cooler months could be to blame

image.altText: Jayne Doherty wearing a white shirt and black blazer

props.synopsis: With three decades experience under her belt, NSW Police's Detective Superintendent Jayne Doherty is trying to change the way sexual assault victim-survivors can access and receive help.

title.children: The head of the NSW Sex Crimes Squad is out to dispel a few prevailing myths

image.altText: Varroa mites on honey bee pupae.

props.synopsis: The honey bee-killing parasite has spread across New South Wales. Now, other states and territories are potentially in the firing line.

title.children: Varroa destructor mites have infested honey bee hives across NSW. No state wants to be next

image.altText: group of happy people in colourful shirts

props.synopsis:
Many festivals are shutting down due to increasing costs, but despite fewer numbers this year organisers are confident this one will survive.

Â

title.children: Like Burning Man but more remote, this is the desert festival Australians are spending big on

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz hugs Frances Tiafoe

props.synopsis: It took five sets and a whole lot of belief for defending champion Carlos Alcaraz to beat Frances Tiafoe on Centre Court, while Emma Raducanu shows her form to set up a battle with the first New Zealand woman to reach the fourth-round in 65 years.

title.children: Wimbledon five quick hits â Alcaraz digs deep, New Zealander achieves 65-year first

image.altText: a black and white photo of seven skiers.

props.synopsis: This weekend marks 100 years since seven skiers hiked up Mount Buller. It was the beginning of one of Australia's most popular snow destinations.

title.children: The first skiers trekked to Mount Buller 100 years ago. Little did they know what they were pioneering

image.altText: Four women are preparing a ballot box ahead of an election.

props.synopsis: Voter turnout during the first round of presidential voting was extremely low.

title.children: Presidential candidates face off in Iran, as voters turn away

image.altText: Two possum-like marsupials lying together in a wooden container.

props.synopsis: An image of two greater gliders cuddled up in a treetop nesting box has been hailed as a long-awaited sign that efforts to rehabilitate a colony in NSW are working.

title.children: Cheers as snuggling marsupial sighting sparks hope for fire-ravaged colony

image.altText: Man in suit with rosary beads around neck walking out of courthouse

props.synopsis: Mr Awad is acquitted of one count of driving without due care and attention causing the death of his wife Marina Hanna in 2022. He pleaded guilty to other charges, including driving without a seatbelt.

title.children: Sydney man found not guilty of causing wife's death in buggy rollover on Hamilton Island honeymoon

image.altText: Anne Jones in a jacket and head scarf

props.synopsis: WA police's internal affairs team are investigating an altercation between a woman who was injured as they arrested her grandson in Geraldton today.

title.children: Police urge calm as they investigate altercation between officer and mother of woman shot dead by police

image.altText: A satellite image of Australia's weather with a BOM logo on ttop.

props.synopsis: A closer look at the Bureau of Meteorology's individual location observation pages sparked online debate and confusion among meteorologists and weather watchers as to whether or not a new record was actually reached.

title.children: BOM says quality checks reveal air pressure record not broken, miscalculations published online

image.altText: A red burst of lava erupts from a crater.

props.synopsis: The volcanic ash from the eruption forced a temporary shutdown at Catania Airport, while Italy's civil protection agency issued a red alert for Stromboli.

title.children: Mt Etna and Stromboli volcanoes erupt over Italy, lighting up skies

image.altText: A woman walks and a teenage girl skips and they smile together walking along a tree-lined pathway outside.

props.synopsis: Lily Gladstone was nominated for an Oscar for their portrayal of historic injustice against First Nations people in Killers of a Flower Moon. Their new film shines a light on how those injustices live on in our modern world.

title.children: Oscar-nominated Lily Gladstone brings quiet power to Fancy Dance, a film by and for First Nations people

image.altText: Brisbane Broncos halfback Jock Madden is seen to by a trainer after an injury in an NRL game.

props.synopsis: The Broncos go down to Penrith in a hotly contested grand final rematch at Lang Park. Earlier, the Sharks lost their fifth game from their past six, outclassed in a 20-16 loss to the Titans in Coffs Harbour.

title.children: Broncos lose another halfback and fifth straight match in grand final rematch with Panthers

image.altText: Brody Mihocek reacts after sustaining an injury against the Bombers.

props.synopsis: The disappointment of the Magpies' 12-point loss to the Bombers is compounded after they learn one of their premiership heroes is likely to miss the rest of the AFL season.

title.children: Magpies set to lose star forward for the season, Bombers move a step closer to ending 23-year drought

image.altText: Jae-myung lies on a stretcher with a white face mask and blue blanket on.

props.synopsis: The knife-wielding man attacked Lee Jae-myung, head of the Democratic Party of Korea, in January after asking for his autograph at an event in the south-eastern city of Busan.

title.children: The man who stabbed South Korea's opposition leader in the neck has been sentenced to 15 years in prison

image.altText: Hand of man inserting a power cord into an electric car

props.synopsis: Car buyers looking for low-emission options are choosing hybrid vehicles over fully battery-powered EVs, according to latest sales figures.

title.children: A surge in hybrid sales has surprised automakers and sounded alarm for emissions

image.altText: Three women wearing green and yellow Australia scarves stand in an empty stadium to pose for a photo

props.synopsis: Football Australia's formal recognition of a women's club team from 1975 as the "first Matildas" has divided the alumni community. Now, many of them are demanding answers.

title.children: 'It's bull****': Matildas alumni slam Football Australia's 1975 recognition

image.altText: A man in a suit walks in front of another man in a suit

props.synopsis: Australia's corporate regulator has long been widely seen as weak and ineffectual. Will this week's Senate report spur a break with its chequered past?

title.children: Bernie Madoff's big mistake? Not setting up his Ponzi scheme in a country where the corporate regulator is asleep at the wheel
